meanings.definition: A long plank balanced in the middle, used as a plaything by children.
meanings.sent1: The children played on the seesaw at the park.
meanings.sent2: The seesaw went up and down as the kids took turns.
meanings.sent3: The seesaw giggled as the children bounced up and down.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a seesaw, always balancing each other out.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the seesaw made it a favorite among the kids.

meanings.definition: To move up and down or back and forth like a seesaw.
meanings.sent1: The boat seesawed on the waves of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: She seesawed on the swing, enjoying the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The seesawing motion of the train made her feel queasy.
meanings.sent4: His emotions seesawed between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The seesawing branches danced in the wind.

meanings.definition: To vacillate or shift rapidly and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: Her decision seesawed back and forth all day.
meanings.sent2: The stock prices seesawed unpredictably throughout the week.
meanings.sent3: The seesawing weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: Their opinions seesawed until they reached a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The seesawing debate kept the audience on edge.
